Lemon melting moments

7 Comments

Tweet
Pin It

Take a trip down memory lane with these buttery biccies. They're great for teatime or with coffee for your next dinner party.

0:30

To Prep

 0:15

To Cook

 10

INGREDIENTS

 20

MAKES

 4.5

AVG RATING

(7 Members)
Rate this
recipe To my
cookbook
MasterChef

MasterChef - July 2010 , Page 120
Recipe by Sophia Young

Photography by Chris Chen

  • Ingredients
  • 200g (1 1/3 cups) plain flour
  • 100g (2/3 cup) cornflour
  • 225g unsalted butter, chopped, softened
  • 80g (1/2 cup) icing sugar, sifted, plus extra, to dust
  • 3 lemons, zested
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract

Passionfruit filling

  • 4 passionfruit, pulp removed
  • 200g (1 1/4 cups) icing sugar, sifted
  • 1 tbs liquid glucose
  • 80g unsalted butter, softened
Add all to list
Add to my Shopping List
Log in to add to My Shopping List
  • Method
  1. Step 1

    1 Preheat oven to 170C. Sift flours with 1/4 tsp salt into a bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar until pale and fluffy. Add zest and vanilla, then gradually beat in combined flours until mixture just comes together.

  2. Step 2

    Roll 2 teaspoonsful of dough into balls, placing them on 2 oven trays lined with baking paper. Using a floured flat bottom of a glass, flatten balls to 3.5cm rounds, then, using the back of a floured fork, mark biscuits with tines. Bake for 12 minutes, swapping trays halfway, or until biscuits are light golden. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Makes 40.

  3. Step 3

    Meanwhile, to make filling, press pulp through a fine sieve, reserving seeds. Place 2 tbs juice, 3 tsp reserved seeds and remaining ingredients in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on high speed until fluffy. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

  4. Step 4

    Spread filling on 20 biscuits, then sandwich with remaining biscuits. Dust with extra icing sugar to serve.

As the weather starts to cool, find out how to make the most of the season with our autumn recipe collection and plan the perfect dinner party with our autumn harvest menu plan.

Lemon melting moments

    Recipe Comments and Reviews

    Have you tried this recipe? Share your thoughts with us below.
    Please feel free to rate & review this recipe.
    Rate this Recipe Ask a question Add to my notes
    • Ratings & Comments (7)
    • Questions (3)
    • My Notes (0)

    Ratings & Comments

    Log In or Register to rate & review this recipe.

    4.5megancunningham added this comment at 11:31pm Thu 20th December, 2012
    Great recipe, easy to make and definately melt in your mouth! I piped out baby sized melting moments to stick together as this is what my gran used to do for us when we were little. Once the mix was in the piping bag I had to soften it for 8-10 seconds in the microwave and it came out perfectly. My daughter thinks they are great! I didnt use this icing recipe due to the concerns other reviewers had ( plus i didnt have any glucose). Just used normal lemon icing. Fabulous with a cup of tea.
    4leemum added this comment at 01:09pm Tue 6th November, 2012
    Beautiful flavour. I used an orange instead of lemon, and left out the passion fruit. I have cooked lots of different melting moment recipes, and my only criticism is that the cream filling after it sat for a while went quite soft. It didn't 'set' or go firmer at all. Perhaps due to the liquid glucose? Next time I'll leave it out and see.
    4.5CBrown added this comment at 01:28pm Tue 28th August, 2012
    So tasty and super quick and easy! I may have to double the qty or reduce the size of the cookies I made as the 2tsp balls ended up only making 10 cookies total. Will definately make again! YUM.
    5Paulihal added this comment at 05:11pm Mon 16th July, 2012
    What can be used in this recipe instead of liquid glucose?
    5beggerz added this comment at 02:07pm Tue 7th February, 2012
    Absolutely delicious!! And super easy. Such a winner
    5fruitbasket added this comment at 12:14am Thu 16th September, 2010
    Just made these - foolproof and delish! I didn't have lemons so I used orange zest and they tasted incredible, would have been yum cookies on their own even without the filling. I changed my filling and did a buttercream frosting filling and added cinnamon and vanilla to it. EASY recipe and a keeper!
    5Kezza610 added this comment at 12:22pm Thu 2nd September, 2010
    Made these for my Mum and firends, they all said they where absolutely delicious.

    Questions

    Log In or Register to ask questions about this recipe.

    pmg asked this question at 07:57am Thu 13th December, 2012
    Question: Hi, how long do these keep once I put the filling in?
    admin replied at 04:14pm Thu 13th December, 2012
    Hi pmg, these will taste best if consumed within 2-3 days.
    moniB asked this question at 09:31pm Wed 22nd August, 2012
    Question: I followed this recipe but my passionfruit filling turned out too runny and oozed out of the middle. Do I need more icing sugar or something?
    Paulihal asked this question at 05:08pm Mon 16th July, 2012
    Question: What can be used instead of liquid Glucose?
    Noonoo replied at 08:52am Thu 16th August, 2012
    Nothing really. There are alternatives, but they'd be harder to find than liquid glucose. You could try honey, I suppose, or even cream. Personally, I'd just leave it out altogther and add extra butter if I felt the mix was too dry.
